meanings.definition: Of or relating to the Christian gospel or the work of evangelists.
meanings.sent1: The church choir sang an evangelic hymn during the Sunday service.
meanings.sent2: Her evangelic beliefs guided her actions in helping those in need.
meanings.sent3: The evangelic preacher's enthusiasm was so contagious, even the squirrels listened.
meanings.sent4: His evangelic fervor lit a fire in the hearts of all who heard him speak.
meanings.sent5: The evangelic message of love and forgiveness resonated deeply with the congregation.

meanings.definition: Characterized by zealous advocacy of a cause.
meanings.sent1: The group's evangelic campaign for environmental protection gained widespread support.
meanings.sent2: Her evangelic dedication to animal rights inspired many to join the cause.
meanings.sent3: The evangelic protest for better school lunches included a giant inflatable carrot.
meanings.sent4: His evangelic commitment to equality shone brightly in his every action.
meanings.sent5: The evangelic fervor of the activists could be felt in every chant and banner.
